overview_of_class: Course Description: An introduction to the literature, culture and history of the country Norman Davies has called "the heart of Europe." In the span of a hundred years Poland has undergone an extraordinary range of transformations and traumas: division among three empires (Russian, German, Austro-Hungarian); the brief period of interwar independence; Nazi and then Soviet subjugation; Solidarity and the revolt against Soviet rule; martial law; and finally independence once again. We will explore the relationship between the history and the culture by way of novels, films, essays, memoirs, historical writing, and poetry. Authors and artists to be discussed include: Czeslaw Milosz, Wislawa Szymborska, Andrzej Wajda, Adam Michnik, Hanna Krall, and others. All work to be read in translation.
